title: 2 Simple Ways to Add Personal Movies to iTunes

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . This looks like a half-blue, half-gray smiling face. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Search for the movie you want to add.
steps.content: Search for the movie you want to add. You'll be able to import your movies to iTunes via Finder once you locate the files. In the search bar, type the name of the movie you're looking for. Your search results will appear. The file's direct location will appear at the bottom of the window once selected.

steps.title: Right-click your video.
steps.content: Right-click your video. A menu will open. If your video is not in .mov, .mp4, or .m4v format, you will get an error when importing. In this case, you'll need to convert the video first.

steps.title: Click Open With.
steps.content: Click Open With . Another menu will expand.

steps.title: ClickiTunes.
steps.content: Click iTunes . Your file will be opened in the iTunes application. iTunes will automatically add the movie to the library. You can also drag-and-drop your video files directly from the Finder into iTunes. Your newly added videos can be found in Home Videos in iTunes.

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. You'll find it in your Windows Start menu. [2] X Research source If you haven't installed iTunes, you'll need to download it first.

steps.title: Click the Edit menu and choose Preferences.
steps.content: Click the Edit menu and choose Preferences .

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . A new window will open

steps.title: Select "Copy files to iTunes Media folder when adding to library".
steps.content: Select "Copy files to iTunes Media folder when adding to library". This will be next to a checkbox. By checking this box, iTunes will create a copy of imported files in the iTunes folder. The original file will remain untouched in its current location. If you want videos to appear in iTunes but stay in their original location, leave this checkbox blank.

steps.title: In the top toolbar, click File.
steps.content: In the top toolbar, click File . This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Add File to Library or Add Folder to Library.
steps.content: Click Add File to Library or Add Folder to Library .

steps.title: Select your video or folder.
steps.content: Select your video or folder. Use File Explorer to find your video or folder. Make sure your video is in .mov, .mp4, or .m4v format. Otherwise, you will get an error. If you add a folder, all the files inside will be added to your iTunes library.

steps.title: Click Home Videos in the left-side panel.
steps.content: Click Home Videos in the left-side panel. This is where you'll find your newly added videos. If you want to remove them later, you can delete movies from iTunes. You can also use iTunes to buy music or send a gift card .
